qas.question: When did many of the largest mobile phone manufacturers sign an EC-sponsored MoU?
What did the MoU make the manufacturers agree to do?

answers.text: to make most data-enabled mobile phones marketed in the European Union compatible with a common External Power Supply

qas.question: When did the IEC release its version of the common EPS standard as IEC 62684:2011?

context: In <a0_0>June 2009<a0_0/>, many of the world's largest mobile phone manufacturers signed an EC-sponsored Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), agreeing <a1_0>to make most data-enabled mobile phones marketed in the European Union compatible with a common External Power Supply<a1_0/> (EPS). The EU's common EPS specification (EN 62684:2010) references the USB Battery Charging standard and is similar to the GSMA/OMTP and Chinese charging solutions. In <a2_0>January 2011<a2_0/>, the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) released its version of the (EU's) common EPS standard as IEC 62684:2011.
